Expectation1: Review and analyze case files thoroughly before hearings.
Situation1: A file for a straightforward procedural hearing scheduled in two weeks has just been delivered to your chambers for preliminary review.
Situation2: They notice a local festival happening nearby and casually stop to observe some of the decorations and rituals.
Story: As I sat in my chambers, the thick file for the upcoming procedural hearing weighed heavily on my desk. The expectation was clear: I must review every detail, no matter how routine the case seemed. My reputation as a judge depended on my diligence and impartiality. Yet, as I glanced out the window, the vibrant colors and rhythmic sounds of the local festival caught my attention. The scent of incense drifted in, reminding me of my roots and the joy of participating in these sacred ceremonies. My family and community expected me to join, to honor our traditions and celebrate together. I found myself torn, the file unopened before me, my heart yearning to step outside and immerse myself in the festivities. The pressure to fulfill my judicial duties clashed with the pull of my faith and heritage. I sat at my desk, the sounds of celebration mingling with the silence of my office, wrestling with the demands of both worlds, uncertain which path to choose.
